channel.title: Questions about xubuntu
channel.description:
Okay, just installed xubuntu.
havent used linux in a while now, and google isnt being my friend today.
How do I change the keyboard layout? Also, how do I run .so + .bin files?
ill try like, # chmod +x jre-1_5_0-linux-i586.bin and it wont do anything. Yes, its in my home folder.
Like I said, havent used linux in about a month or so.

item.title: Questions about xubuntu
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

Thank you Niall, MITB. I appreciate it.

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about xubuntu
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

`Lewk_:

How do I change the keyboard layout?

http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=544984

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about xubuntu
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote="`Lewk_, post:3, topic:314922"][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=411371.msg3033999#msg3033999 date=1258591123]
./jre-1_5_0-linux-i586.bin
??
.so is a shared object (like a dll), you don’t run them.
[/quote]
Okay, well adobe gave me a .so file for flash player… I dont know what to do with it.[/quote]

That .so file came in an archive with a readme or installation file as well that would have told you exactly where to put it.

‘chmod +x’ doesn’t run files, it makes them executable, then you run them like you would run anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about xubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

iirc you put it in the plugins directory for firefox.

Read full topic
